meta.title: María-Fernanda Villalobos | Frontend Developer
meta.description: Portfolio of María-Fernanda Villalobos, a Frontend Developer recognized as #3 in React in Chile. Specialist in creating inclusive, accessible, and high-performance web experiences.
meta.og_description: Specialist in creating inclusive, accessible, and high-performance web experiences.

nav.logoAlt: Logo with a violet background and María-Fernanda's initials.

hero.name: María-Fernanda Villalobos
hero.headline: Frontend Developer | #3 React.js Developer in Chile (GitHunter)
hero.mission: Passionate about Inclusive Design and crafting accessible web experiences. I transform complex problems into fluid, efficient, and intuitive software solutions.

about.title: My Philosophy
about.image_alt: Hologram of María-Fernanda projected from a mobile phone.
about.paragraph_1: Being recognized as the #3 React Developer in Chile is more than a ranking; it's a driver for my mission to build technology that feels human. I strive to create interfaces where performance and empathy coexist, ensuring every interaction is both powerful and intuitive.
about.paragraph_2: My background in health sciences taught me to listen with empathy. Today, I apply that same principle to code, focusing on the 'details that matter.' This translates into accessible, user-centric experiences where every pixel has a purpose.
about.ideal_team_paragraph: I thrive in collaborative teams that value creative problem-solving and are passionate about building products that make a real difference.

project_1.name: PyDay Chile Conference Website
project_1.challenge: To develop the first complete Single-Page Application (SPA) for the Python Chile community under a record-time deadline and with the constraint of a pre-existing brand identity.
project_1.contribution: I architected and developed the application in Next.js, creating an intuitive navigation structure. Additionally, I introduced a formal documentation process to align the volunteer team and successfully navigated complex team dynamics, letting the quality of the technical result speak for itself.
project_1.result: The project was delivered on time, exceeding expectations, and served as the main information hub for attendees, setting a new standard for the community's websites.

project_2.name: Client Project: Valeria del Real
project_2.challenge: To create the first professional website for a client with decades of experience in therapies but new to the digital world, who provided low-resolution visual assets.
project_2.contribution: I managed the entire project from concept to deployment. I designed and developed the site, paying special attention to optimizing and treating the images to ensure professional performance and aesthetics despite their original quality.
project_2.result: A functional, deployed website that fulfilled the client's vision, serving as a professional platform for her brand and demonstrating my ability to guide non-technical clients through the digitalization process.

project_3.name: Hites - Mobile E-commerce Challenge
project_3.challenge: In a 24-hour technical challenge, replicate a desktop product page into a fully responsive, mobile-first version, based solely on a screenshot.
project_3.contribution: I built the interface from scratch with React, focusing on a flexible layout. In a pre-generative-AI challenge, I took the initiative to extract, edit, and optimize visual assets directly from the production site—a resourceful move that impressed the hiring team.
project_3.result: A functional and visually faithful landing page that demonstrated my ability to work with speed and proactivity. My solution stood out among other candidates and positioned me as one of the two finalists for the role.

contact.title: Contact
contact.subtitle: Let's Build Something Amazing Together
contact.invitation: I am available for new challenges. If you have a project in mind or an opportunity that aligns with my profile, feel free to reach out.

footer.text: Designed and built with care by María-Fernanda Villalobos.
